items.title: What are Tariffs?
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>What are tariffs? 
Tariffs are taxes or duties that countries apply to imports. They don’t appear on sales receipts.  

Why do countries use tariffs? 
To raise revenue for public services and/ or to protect domestic production by making foreign goods more expensive. 

How do tariffs affect me?  
Tariffs can impact the prices you pay at the store. When the cost of importing goods increases, businesses pass the bulk of this cost onto consumers.  

Why do Canada’s free trade agreements matter?  
Canada’s 15 free trade agreements provide Canadians with tariff-free access to nearly all products traded between Canada and its free-trade partners. This helps Canadian businesses access markets in over 50 countries representing 1.5 billion consumers and keeps us connected to the world. 

For more information: https://www.canada.ca/unitedstatestariffs</article>

items.title: G7 2025 Short Logo Reveal
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>G7 2025 Kananaskis Short Logo Reveal
Showing scenic shots of a mountain in the Kananaskis area with a river and forest in the foreground, overlaid at the end with the G7 2025 Kananaskis logo featuring a grey stylized image of a mountain and a green pine tree with seven branches. The video is accompanied by background music.</article>

items.title: Team Canada Trade Missions – 2024 edition
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>In 2024, Canada led trade missions to Malaysia, Vietnam, South Korea, Indonesia, and the Philippines as part of Canada’s Indo-Pacific Strategy. 
 
These trade missions open doors for companies and organizations to broaden their reach and unlock new opportunities while helping Canada expand trade, investment, and supply chain resilience and deepening connections with the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) and the broader Indo-Pacific region. 
 
Learn more about Canada’s Team Canada Trade Missions: https://www.international.gc.ca/trade-commerce/trade_events-evenements_commerciaux/trade_missions-missions_commerciales/about-a_propos.aspx?lang=eng  
 
#GoTeamCanadaTrade #IndoPacific #IndoPacificStrategy</article>

items.title: Minister Ng shares how CPTPP impacts Canadians and the world
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>In 2 weeks, Canada will welcome fellow Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP) members in Vancouver for the #CPTPP Commission Meeting. 

As we look forward to this important event, listen in as Minister Ng shares how CPTPP impacts Canadians and the world.  

#CPTPPCanada2024</article>

items.title: Can we learn to spot disinformation?
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>Can we learn to spot disinformation? How can people protect themselves against disinformation?

We talked to Kathryn Hill, executive director of MediaSmarts, about digital literacy and how people can learn how to improve their disinformation detection skills. 

To learn more about Canada’s efforts to counter state-sponsored disinformation: https://www.international.gc.ca/world-monde/issues_development-enjeux_developpement/peace_security-paix_securite/combatt-disinformation-desinformation.aspx?lang=eng

Watch Next: https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLI-XuG0q34g1vTEhTCfYtl-80tPNtu5CA&si=rzSRMVpqF8oS95bS

00:55 How to avoid spreading disinformation
02:08 How disinformation works
02:59 The ecosystem of information</article>

items.title: Was sind Verzerrungen in der KI? / What is Bias in AI?
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>Dieses Interview mit Saniye Gülser Corat wurde im März 2024 in Wien während einer Expertenrunde zum Internationalen Frauentag gefilmt, die von der Botschaft Kanadas in Österreich zum Thema „Frauen in der Wissenschaft“ organisiert wurde, um die Bedeutung der weiblichen Perspektive in den MINT-Fächern hervorzuheben.

This interview with Saniye Gülser Corat was filmed in March 2024 in Vienna during an expert panel event to highlight International Women’s Day co-organized by the Embassy of Canada to Austria on “Women in Science” to highlight the importance of female perspective in STEM disciplines.</article>

items.title: A conversation on Canada’s National Action Plan on Women, Peace and Security
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>Minister Joly sat down with Katrina Leclerc to discuss Foundations for Peace: Canada’s national action plan on Women, Peace and Security.

00:00 – 2:47 – Opening remarks
2:48-4:32 – Introduction to Canada’s National Action Plan on Women, Peace and Security
4:36-7:49 - Muzna Dureid’s question
7:50-9:47 - Joseph Akilimali’s question
9 :48-14:46 - Hala Al-Karib’s question
14:47-17:45 - Katrina Leclerc’s question
17 :46-19 :36 – Closing remarks

Learn more about the Action Plan here: https://www.international.gc.ca/world-monde/issues_development-enjeux_developpement/gender_equality-egalite_des_genres/cnap_wps-pnac_fps.aspx?lang=eng

#WomenPeaceSecurity</article>

items.title: How important is resilience to disinformation?
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>How important is resilience to disinformation? How can people protect themselves against disinformation? How can governments prepare to defend themselves against disinformation?

We talked to Lutz Güllner, head of Strategic Communications at the European External Action Service, about the impact of disinformation on democracies and how countries can protect themselves against it.  
 
To learn more about Canada’s efforts to counter state-sponsored disinformation: https://www.international.gc.ca/world-monde/issues_development-enjeux_developpement/peace_security-paix_securite/combatt-disinformation-desinformation.aspx?lang=eng

CHAPTERS
00:00 Disinformation & Democracy
00:23 How important is resilience to disinformation?
01:45 How can people protect themselves against disinformation?
3:16 How can governments better prepare to defend themselves against disinformation?</article>

items.title: Canada and the G7 | 🌍 Exciting News for 2025! 🌟
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>🌍 Exciting News for 2025! 🌟

Once again, assuming the G7 Presidency, #Canada is set to host the Leaders Summit. We are thrilled to announce that the Summit will return to the breathtaking Kananaskis, Alberta, a testament to Canada's global leadership and natural beauty. 🍁🏞️

This momentous event provides us with a unique platform to showcase our leadership, foster international collaboration, and highlight the natural beauty of Kananaskis. With its awe-inspiring landscapes and rich cultural heritage, #Kananaskis is the perfect setting for discussions of national and international importance. The decision to hold the Summit in Alberta shows our commitment to inclusivity and unity. Let's seize this opportunity to inspire and shape a better future together. 

Stay tuned for more updates as we gear up for this significant event!

#G7Canada,#G7Kananaskis2025,#ExploreCanada,#GovernmentofCanada,#GOC,#InternationalRelations,#SustainableFuture</article>
